Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Moonlight \Moon`light`\ (m[=oo]n"l[imac]t`), n. The light of the moon. -- a. Occurring during or by moonlight; characterized by moonlight. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Moonlight \Moon"light`\ (m[=oo]n"l[imac]t`), v. i. to work at a second job in addition to one's main occupation; -- often done at night. [PJC]

moonlight n : the light of the moon; "moonlight is the smuggler's enemy"; "the moon was bright enough to read by" [syn: {moonshine}, {moon}] v : work a second job, usually after hours; "The law student is moonlighting as a taxi driver"
